note: The class will always be srap:SRAPResource.
Resource type, using the COAR Resorce Types vocabulary.
A language of the resource.
An entity responsible for making contributions to the resource.
The name of an entity responsible for making contributions to the resource.
An entity responsible for making the resource.
The name of an entity responsible for making the resource.
An entity responsible for making the resource available.
The name of an entity responsible for making the resource available.
The topic of the resource; a concept from a controlled vocabulary such as LCSH or MeSH
A name given to the resource.
The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource.
Version type, using the COAR Version Types vocabulary.
Date associated with the resource. Use more specific dates if available.s
Date of formal issuance of the resource.
Date on which the resource was changed.
Date of acceptance of the resource.
Date when the resource was retracted or withdrawn.
A period of time during which the resource is under embargo.
A volume number of the periodical where this article was published
An issue number of the periodical that this article was published in
Starting page number within a continuous page range.
Ending page number within a continuous page range.
A related resource in which the described resource is physically or logically included.
Conference, workshop or other scientific event where the scholarly resource was presented.
A bibliographic reference for the resource.
A name or identifier of a related resource; use the SRAPResource shape if additional information is desired.
A SRAPResource description of a related resource.
A summary of the resource.
A list of subunits of the resource.
An account of the resource.
Access status of the resource, using the COAR Access Rights vocabulary.
A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource.
Information about rights held in and over the resource.
A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.
A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.
Textual information describing the accessibility features of a resource, including technical details.
Organization or organizational unit where the scholarly activity was conducted.
A grant that directly or indirectly provides funding or sponsorship for the resource.
A RAiD handle or other identifier for the project.
URI, one for each identifier the resource has, provided separately
The International Standard Book Number of the resource.
URL where the electronic resource (e.g., a file) or a part of it can be retrieved.
Class (always bibo:Periodical or one of its subclasses)
A name given to the resource. Titles in different languages provided separately
Name of the publisher
The International Standard Serial Number, ISSN, an identifier for the printed version of serial publications.
The International Standard Serial Number, ISSN, an identifier for electronic versions of serial publications.

Name of person
Identifier for the person, such as ORCID
